intro: Sisymbrium hispidulum var. brevistylum, commonly known as the hairy shepherd's purse, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods and hairy stems. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
